Expedition LifeHits
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Expeditions: General Questions: Expedition LifeHits
By Krysis Adelis on Wednesday, August 22, 2001 - 10:38 pm:

It has been said in other threads that aside from the one for one rate that a monster looses life, that is, one week lived, one week lost, there is also the possibilty of encurring other, unnessasary, loses to the expected life of a monster. The first of these being when the sum of Fatigue and double it's Stress is greater than 70(F+2S>70 for those of you that didn't sleep through algebra ;) ), and you lose an extra week. This is calculated every week when the screen goes dark.

My question is, since Expeditions have no dark screens aside from when they start and when they end, and cause only 70 fatigue, no stress, do you only loose that extra week for the LifeHit Index being over 70? or three for the two dark spots and the LifeHit Index? or the normal four plus the extra hit?

By Nightdagger on Thursday, August 23, 2001 - 07:55 am:

So far as I can tell, you take the normal 4 weeks of lifespan loss, for your monster being alive during the 4 weeks of expedition, plus an extra week as a lifespan hit from fatigue. I don't have the tools to check for sure though, and devising a test that didn't require special equipment would take some time, so...that's my best guess.
